The Calendar (New Style) Act 1750 (c.23) was an Act of the Parliament of Great 
Britain. It reformed the calendar of England and British Dominions so that the new 
legal year began on 1 January rather than 25 March (Lady Day); and it adopted 
the Gregorian calendar, ... As a result of the Act, Scotland adopted the Gregorian 
calendar in 1752.
